topics.body:
*Shakespearean quality literature here*
me towards him, and you took the instruction. You grabbed tightly onto his hand when you reached the bench he was on, he was colder than ice. On his snout, a weak smile formed. 
“(Y/n)… I… I’m sorry, lass… after what we’ve been through… all of it… from the very beginning… it’s been an honour…” He rasped quietly, barley able to form longer words.
“It hasn’t just been an honour, it will continue to be an honour.” You sobbed. He pulled you to him, your head against his chest. He shook his head subtly.
“No, lass. You’ve done enough, it’s time for Foxy to go down with his ship. It’s what all good captains do.” He chuckled weakly, his voice dimming,
“But you aren’t any old captain, foxy, You’re the best captain that’s ever been.”  You cried much harder, and he pulled you even closer. He held onto you as hard as you cried.
“I love you… my First mate, forever and always…” He kissed you heavily and rolled into the furnace.
